author: realjosiah
title: Thrift Mobile Wallet
description: Lack of a wallet oriented to savings and financial health through DeFi, focused on developing countries. THRIFT token.

f6_assessments.q0: The project wants to build a mobile application - a wallet for saving and handling all ada transactions along with metrics and usefull information. I like the idea that saving means foresight, I agree with this assessment as it's said in the proposal there are good times and bad and we need to prepare for both. The proposal is in the right challenge settings bulding an application for the communitys use. This project will bring value to the cardano community as a whole, and because they plan on the mobile application to be simple and easy to use, they might bring some outside members as well. The KPIs are relevant to the challenge they're faced with, and as a developer I think the level of detail about the technical implementation is admirable. With the team described, I see no future problems scaling. I'm sure all challenges will be met. Maybe one thing I would have liked to see more of is for the authors to take a look around of what's already been done and use it, instead of building everything from the bottom up, but both approaches have their benefits. I don't see missing required parts from the listed items in the proposal.  As a developer I don't have any concerns about this proposal and I urge people to vote for this.
f6_assessments.q1: There are plenty of linkedin links which is all I usually look for anyway. If names are stated the first thing I would do is look for them in linin. I like proposers that stand behind their project with their name. This brings credability to the project in my eyes of a voter. The team members are already grouped up and working, so I'd say the type and number required to implement the proposal is checked. The budget could be broken down to hourly rates to enable easy comparison between other such projects, but other than that it's outlined well where the money will go. The offered timetable seems realistic to me as a developer to do the described work in the proposal. The plan for implementation is more than sensible, it's concrete. For those of us who've read 40+ proposal, it's rare to see so much technical details listed in a proposal. As a technical person myself I can appreciate the effor to describe the architecture and technologies to be used. I like there are picture of how the possible implementation design would look like. This is extra effor that community members like because they can more easily imagine if they would use such a wallet at an early stage.  Some possible challenges are mentioned along with the process the team will follow to overcome them. People with such long experience shouldn't find problems rising up to challenges. The one small critique I have is the lack of research done on what's already out there and can be reused, but that's not such a big deal since every developer working on something new will aquire a new skillset and the less reused code, the better the dev will become. So that's kind of an investment of the future projects the devs will be workin on. Good luck to you and your proposal on the voting stage!
f6_assessments.q2: How will the projects progress be traced by the community? This is one of the questions I ask myself and the authors didn't disapoint here as well. There will be progress updates every two weeks on social media which is great that it's explicitly promised and mentioned in the project. Many proposers don't pay the necessary attention to the community access to information about the project progress. The mentioned KPIs are relevant and describe the success of the proposal if met. I didn't see any metrics like adoption rate, application downloads and so on, which is kind of disapointing so I'd suggest for the team to add them in future proposals. It's usefull to compare your expectations with reality down the line. A sensible roadmap and milestones were provided and a timeframe to work on all necessary described tasks. A clear problem and a solution to match have been listed in the proposal.   Overall I think the project is tracable, but if they can add a channel for getting feedback from the community in the form of a discrord or telegram chnnel it would be beneficial for both sides.

f6_assessments.q0:
It is a nice idea to provide some financial education to the people using some savings and costs analysis implemented in the wallet, yet I am not strongly convinced that it will be as successful as predicted.

To boost this, it would be nice to see what current wallets are missing and what your wallet will offer that will shift them or attract new people to it. Right now, I feel that there are too many wallets and I think if the only feature would be savings and costs analysis, staking...I do not see a large impact on cardano adoption (which is a challenging goal).

You would have to come up with something breaking, but you are facing a large competition. Cardano has already multiple wallets if I am not mistaken.

Rating 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the experience and detailed roadmap, I believe that they have a solid idea of how to finish and implement the final product. 

Rating 5.

f6_assessments.q0:
I believe this proposal effectively onboards new users that aren't typically engaged in defi to the Cardano blockchain, which fits the challenge category well.

Although there are many mobile wallets already competing for this title, this one seems to be targeting Africa, which may give it a local advantage verses wallets more tailored to western audiences. This could fill a very important purpose of onboarding those users better and more seamlessly.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposing team consists of a Plutus Pioneer who has founded previous IT and blockchain startups, and has been working to bridge the traditional financial world. Other team member includes a developer with significant experience in the Cardano ecosystem. 

I think based on the team, and prior works combined this will produce a favourable outcome for both the proposal and project catalyst itself. The plan is very details and includes specifics such as which functions are to be finished and delivered into the end product. This gives me high hope that they will be successful with this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap really looks fantastic, sensible yet worthy milestones and you have the KPIs listed for the milestones. The detail you have added to the roadmap makes it easy to audit and verify the relative success of the proposal!

The team also plans to update their socials every two weeks in order to stay accountable to the community, in addition to the detailed roadmap included.

f6_assessments.q0: The implementation of a savings wallet is well placed within the challenge and if successful will clearly bring value to the Cardano ecosystem as a whole.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is clearly defined with LinkedIn links and relevant experience of all members provided. The funds are clearly broken down and reasonably allocated. The plan is clearly presented and it is nice to see they are thinking of possible failure points even if none are currently apparent.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is well defined and a large list of auditable KPIs are provided with bi-weekly status reports promised therefore this tells me the project success will be easily auditable.

f6_assessments.q0:
It seems like a good proposal to me, because today there are many people with difficulties managing their expenses and they cannot find a way to save for times of emergency or when they really need that financial help to solve a problem.
Financial health is increasingly important in a world where the economy is the basis of everything and I believe that this project can improve the quality of life of many people.
f6_assessments.q1:
A team with so much experience has no doubt that it will guide a project that can be developed successfully in the future.
In addition, that the savings plan is personalized may attract users.
I am missing a detailed explanation of the steps to follow to achieve the objective to be able to decide if this project, indeed, will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2:
I think there is a lot of information lacking on the method to achieve the objective and that expanding it would be important to attract investors.
After reading the proposal I have continued with the doubt of how to carry it out.
Although I support the idea, I think a more detailed explanation is needed to be able to rate it as really good.
